column4: If the ACA is overturned, at least 122,000 Alabamians will lose their health care in the middle of a pandemic. People with pre-existing conditions would be charged higher rates or have their health care coverage ended altogether.

The administration and several states, including Alabama, are advocating to completely eliminate The Affordable Care Act. Instead of working to improve it, they're pursuing overturning the entire law in the highest court in the land in the middle of this pandemic.

I also believe his decision to force through this confirmation instead of negotiating a bipartisan COVID relief package is an insult to the millions of Americans who are suffering as a result of this pandemic.

This pandemic has made the need to access broadband even greater. Tele-health & tele-medicine are an important part of ensuring folks in our communities can stay safe & healthy. We must work to ensure all communities have broadband access. https://t.co/NLupvwfctj
COVID cases are spiking across the country. We ALL need to work together and wear our masks. #MaskUpAL https://t.co/oMTXjOFrXx

So many veterans can’t or don’t access the mental health care they need, and as a result, more than 20 veterans die by suicide every day.
 
It was an honor to cosponsor this new law that is going to save veteran lives here in Alabama and across the country. https://t.co/rmbYA3FCWi

I know many families across Alabama love to celebrate Halloween with trick-or-treating. But this year, in light of the COVID-19 pandemic, I want to encourage you to look toward safe and fun alternatives. 👻🎃
https://t.co/t0lbm4df7s

This pandemic has been a challenging time for all of us and has exacerbated mental health issues for many folks. I’m proud to have introduced a bipartisan bill to increase funding for the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline program so everyone can get the help they need.

Hey y’all, it’s not too late to get your flu shot! Getting your flu shot is going to be critical in helping us fight COVID-19 this winter & keep our health care systems from being overwhelmed. https://t.co/Ho3Po5Wooh

Too many rural communities are getting left behind—especially as the world becomes increasingly digital during this pandemic. We must ensure *all* communities have reliable access to broadband & high speed internet.
https://t.co/PCyID9J15d

For so many of our veterans, its often the wounds we can’t see that hurt the most. I’m proud to have cosponsored this bill—which is now law—that will connect more veterans with life-saving mental health care, and expand resources to help them and their families heal. https://t.co/k2eFgRmoYU

Let's continue to listen to our public health experts like Dr. Fauci, and wear our masks, stay home and social distance as much as possible. We can beat this virus but it’s going to take all of us. #MaskUpAL

✅ Helps to prevent the flu, which shares many of the same symptoms as COVID-19

What do asthma, diabetes, & cancer have in common with COVID-19?
 
All are considered pre-existing conditions. 
 
If the #ACA is struck down in the Supreme Court, millions of Americans with pre-existing conditions will be at risk of losing coverage and care. #ProtectOurCare

For 55 years, Medicaid & Medicare have ensured Americans have access to affordable health care—for many, these programs are literal lifelines. On their anniversary, we must recommit to preserving these programs that protect millions of American's health & well-being.

Across Alabama, folks are increasingly finding themselves without health care and jobs, and many hospitals are struggling.

In this public health crisis, Alabama can't afford *not* to expand Medicaid. This isn’t a partisan issue—it's just the right thing to do. https://t.co/2kckAQ4aeB
